sentences: Oren Ambarchi (born 1969) is an Australian musician.
Oren Ambarchi was born in Sydney to an Iraqi Jewish family.
Ambarchi has been performing live since 1986.
In the late 1980s he played free jazz in Sydney, originally as a drummer.

Ambarchi contributed to drone metal band Sunn O)))'s Black One album in 2005, and has since become a frequent live performer with the band, as well as contributing to the Oracle EP and Monoliths & Dimensions album.
Ambarchi also works in popular music contexts and is a drummer for the group Sun with composer/musician Chris Townend.
In May 2010, he performed live with Boris at the Vivid Live Noise Night curated by Lou Reed and Laurie Anderson.
Ambarchi begins a series of duo recordings with multi-instrumentalist Jim O'Rourke, the first one being the acclaimed 'Indeed' in 2011.
In 2017 he worked with composer Alvin Lucier, performing new compositions for electric guitar.
